newsitem.title: PERU: Peru Jan-Nov trade deficit off 10 pct at $1.8 bln.
newsitem.headline: Peru Jan-Nov trade deficit off 10 pct at $1.8 bln.

text.p: Peru's trade deficit fell 10 percent in the first 11 months of the year to $1.814 billion from $2.016 billion in the same period last year, the Central Reserve Bank said on Friday.
Exports in the January to November period rose 5.5 percent to $5.329 billion, while imports over the same period rose one percent to $7.143 billion, the bank said in its weekly report.

Peru's traditional export sectors of minerals, oil, agriculture and fishing grew six percent in the first 11 months to $3.816 billion. The fastest growing export sector was crude oil and products, which rose 51 percent to $333 million.
Non-traditional exports grew by nine percent to $1.427 billion.

The bank attributed the one percent growth in imports to higher rates of consumption. Among imports, foodstuffs rose 32 percent to $766 million, largely due to higher international prices for flour, rice and soya, the bank added.
